questions.question: What is Transcreation?
options: A. The process of translating a text from one language to another
B. The process of adapting a text to a different cultural and linguistic context
C. The process of interpreting a text in multiple ways
D. The process of creating a new text from scratch

questions.question: What is the role of a Transcreator?
options: A. To translate a text word-for-word
B. To interpret a text in multiple ways
C. To adapt a text to a different cultural and linguistic context
D. To create a new text from scratch

questions.question: How does Transcreation impact interpretation?
options: A. It enhances the accuracy of interpretation
B. It simplifies the interpretation process
C. It adds cultural and linguistic nuances to the interpretation
D. It eliminates the need for interpretation

questions.question: What is the relevance of Transcreation?
options: A. It is only relevant in certain industries
B. It is irrelevant in today's globalized world
C. It helps bridge cultural and linguistic gaps in communication
D. It is primarily used for literary purposes

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of Transcreation?
options: A. Translating a legal document
B. Adapting a marketing slogan for a different market
C. Interpreting a conversation between two people
D. Creating a new language
